verses.roman:
'kṛṣṇa-bhakti-rasa-svarūpa' śrī-bhāgavata
tāte veda-śāstra haite parama mahattva

synonyms: kṛṣṇa-bhakti—of devotional service to Kṛṣṇa; rasa—of the transcendental mellow; svarūpa—the very form; śrī-bhāgavata—Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam; tāte—therefore; veda-śāstra—the Vedic literature; haite—than; parama mahattva—has greater utility and value.
translation: "Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam gives direct information of the mellow derived from service to Kṛṣṇa. Therefore Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam is above all other Vedic literatures.
